0.Message:: pushlog: switch custom revset definitions to use `@revsetpredicate` r=gps  Looks like the upstream bug has been fixed for some time, and the tests are passing under 4.6.2.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D2961

1.Message:: testing: rename test files with duplicated names (Bug 1481583) r=gps  This commit makes every test in version-control-tools have a unique name. It also updates `test-obsolescence.t` to it's new name in the `exclude_reviewboard.txt` list.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D2886

2.Message:: scripts: also update .hg/store/00changelog.i mtime  This is what hgwebdir actually uses.

4.Message:: scripts: always adjust mtime, also update mtime of main repo dir

5.Message:: scripts: parse time correctly; improve error messaging

6.Message:: scripts: add script to adjust repo mtime

7.Message:: ansible: deploy to hgssh2.dmz.mdc1  The server exists and is ready to be bootstrapped.

8.Message:: ansible: stop deploying to hgweb[56]  The hosts are no longer serving production traffic.

9.Message:: ansible: disable zookeeper and kafka on hgweb[56]  They are the temporary hosts and will soon be removed.

10.Message:: ansible: enable zookeeper and kafka on hgweb[34]  The hosts are now in service and will be the permanent hosts. Let's enable zookeeper and kafka on them.

11.Message:: docs: add documentation about automated clients

13.Message:: serverlog: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.6 (Bug 1446453) r=gps  We forgot to do this during the 4.6 upgrade and some output about incompatible Mercurial versions is present in the bootstrap output logs.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D2890

14.Message:: ansible/hg-ssh: allow new root on NSS repos (bug 1481136); r=sheehan  There is a global hook on all non-user repos that limits pushes to repos introducing a new root changeset. Any repos wishing to pushing a new root must have that new root annotated in the config.  This commit annotates that root in the NSS repo.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D2880

15.Message:: ansible: add hgweb[34] to ansible inventory

16.Message:: ci: use docker image v0.5  This image has "watchman" installed, for `test-fsmonitor.t`.

17.Message:: ci: install watchman in Docker image r=gps  We currently see "skipped: require Watchman" for `test-fsmonitor.t` when we run tests in CI. Let's add it to the image.  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D2751

18.Message:: ansible/hg-web: increase httpd timeout from 120s to 180s  Correlating timestamps seem to indicate that git-cinnabar is hitting this 120s timeout and causing https://github.com/glandium/git-cinnabar/issues/192. Let's try increasing to 180s to see if that's enough to make git-cinnabar happy until git-cinnabar can work around the problem.

19.Message:: hgwsgi: enable hosting of repos under /mozreview/  (bug 1480892)  We don't yet expose a link to these repos in the index. But URL serving should work just fine.

19.Message:: Bug 1469610: [releaserunner3] Pass the decision task id as `taskGroupId` to actions; r=aki  This is what what the specification[1] for actions indicates should be passed.  The comment about `ACTION_TASK_GROUP_ID` was incorrect, as the release promotion action always used the task id of the action task for the new group, and ignored that environment variable.  [1] https://docs.taskcluster.net/docs/manual/using/actions/spec#json-e-context  Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D1709

14.Message:: Bug 1402247 - Use encoding_rs for XPCOM string encoding conversions. r=Nika,erahm,froydnj.  Correctness improvements:     UTF errors are handled safely per spec instead of dangerously truncating    strings.     There are fewer converter implementations.  Performance improvements:     The old code did exact buffer length math, which meant doing UTF math twice    on each input string (once for length calculation and another time for    conversion). Exact length math is more complicated when handling errors    properly, which the old code didn't do. The new code does UTF math on the    string content only once (when converting) but risks allocating more than    once. There are heuristics in place to lower the probability of    reallocation in cases where the double math avoidance isn't enough of a    saving to absorb an allocation and memcpy.     Previously, in UTF-16 <-> UTF-8 conversions, an ASCII prefix was optimized    but a single non-ASCII code point pessimized the rest of the string. The    new code tries to get back on the fast ASCII path.     UTF-16 to Latin1 conversion guarantees less about handling of out-of-range    input to eliminate an operation from the inner loop on x86/x86_64.     When assigning to a pre-existing string, the new code tries to reuse the    old buffer instead of first releasing the old buffer and then allocating a    new one.     When reallocating from the new code, the memcpy covers only the data that    is part of the logical length of the old string instead of memcpying the    whole capacity. (For old callers old excess memcpy behavior is preserved    due to bogus callers. See bug 1472113.)     UTF-8 strings in XPConnect that are in the Latin1 range are passed to    SpiderMonkey as Latin1.  New features:     Conversion between UTF-8 and Latin1 is added in order to enable faster    future interop between Rust code (or otherwise UTF-8-using code) and text    node and SpiderMonkey code that uses Latin1.  MozReview-Commit-ID: JaJuExfILM9

12.Message:: Bug 1454627 - Fix timing issue in browser_ext_user_events.js. r=mixedpuppy, a=test-only  The hard-coded wait exists to avoid a test failure caused by a non-functional click event in an options browser. However, that still does not get rid of the intermittent failure.  To really avoid the timing issue, check whether onclick was fired after supposedly triggering a click, and if not, wait and retry.  MozReview-Commit-ID: 9eg6sz1s1e3

18.Message:: Bug 1474883 - Ensure D2D glyph cache is pruned after rendering 1000 transformed glyphs. r=bas, a=RyanVM  Rendering glyphs at many different rotations was causing the D2D glyph cache to grow very large. Calling EndDraw/BeginDraw will prune the cache, but is costly, so only do it for every 1000 glyphs.  MozReview-Commit-ID: HUFpxDvYAzQ

4.Message:: Bug 1475571 - Replace follow-on addon with in tree telemetry. r=mikedeboer,florian, a=RyanVM

5.Message:: Bug 1476605 - Fix Error rep failure when stacktrace is a longString. r=sole, a=RyanVM  The actual fix for this issue will come in a future reps bundle when https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/pull/6705 gets merged. But, I do want this change to be uplifted to release, and it should be easier to only apply this simple change than the whole next release which would contain unrelated code changes. Also, this patch introduces a test to make sure we don't ever regress this.  MozReview-Commit-ID: 3QPrx3TLln0

6.Message:: Bug 1480612 - Part 3: Test Register Application Restart more thoroughly. r=whimboo, a=RyanVM

7.Message:: Bug 1480612 - Part 2: Session restore, fixes for screen listing and args, session store fixes and tests. r=agashlin, a=RyanVM  This is a roll-up of patches landed for Firefox 62+ in bug 603903, bug 1463560, bug 1458119, and bug 1466071.

8.Message:: Bug 1480612 - Part 1: Add RegisterApplicationRestart. r=jimm, a=RyanVM  Slightly modified to avoid including the following changes: 1) MakeCommandLine was moved to mozilla::MakeCommandLine 2) CheckArg's signature was changed 3) Something with UniquePtr, just went with a straightforward free()  This originally landed for Firefox 62+ in bug 603903.  MozReview-Commit-ID: Eb389ih7CIn

9.Message:: Bug 1480826 - Reenable telemetry.os_shutting_down probe. r=chutten, a=RyanVM  This records whether the shutdown ping was generated during an OS shutdown.

13.Message:: Bug 1474379 - Match regex against the entire panel ID. r=miker,rpl a=RyanVM  So panels provided by extensions with IDs that contain words like "inspector" don't break. Include test in existing panel creation test.  MozReview-Commit-ID: JerMCaKRgkl

14.Message:: Bug 1472996 - Use a new accessible node for each a11y focus event. r=jchen, a=RyanVM  This allows us to avoid using removeAction which needs a higher API version.

15.Message:: Bug 1474007 - Null check to prevent crash when ipc::mscom::GetInitialInterceptorForIID fails after PublishTarget. r=aklotz, a=RyanVM  PublishTarget calls Unlock on our LiveSetAutolock. It's possible for GetInitialInterceptorForIID to fail after this point. This will cause the failure cleanup code to run, which tries to call Unlock again. However, the previous call to Unlock set mLiveSet to null, and Unlock previously didn't handle this case. Now, unlock is a no-op (in release builds) if it's already been called.  MozReview-Commit-ID: 15ffXR6nKqc
